page.title: 19Widgery Cross
page.content: In 1887 Mr W Widgery put a cross on Brat Tor for the Jubilee of Queen Victoria. The cross is not one whole piece of rock , but some chunks of rocks stuck together by cement. To get to the cross pass over the River Lydd by the stepping stones. From the foot of Brat Tor the cross does not look the 13ft height it has. After crossing the Lydd you climb the steep slopes of Brat Tor. The slopes are rocky, heather and blueberry covered. When you have climbed the hill you feel very tierd. The top of the tor is an outcrop of granite. The granite has horizonal cracks going across it. The outcrop is high. The cross makes the tor more interesting, and makes you want to climb the tor for a closer view. A.J.Mullan
